author: soispoke
content:
Ah ok I see your point! Yes I guess users could more easily set priority fees to 0 and get included by IL committee members. If the goal is only to get included, I think that's fine: their transactions are still valid according to the protocol (i.e., as long as they pay the base fee) so in theory they should be included even if they don't tip proposers/builders. 

Now imagine users decide to use the priority fees to pay to the IL committee instead, just to get included (do you just pick one? do you split the fees and send across all IL committee members?). The fees should be insignificant, because you could always just send you txn to the public mempool and expect it to be picked up by one of the IL committee members anyway? I agree this is not a perfect design, that's why we're working on a proper transaction fee mechanism for FOCIL (e.g., priority fees could be split across IL committee members that include a txn, or there could be a dedicated "inclusion fee", see https://ethresear.ch/t/towards-attester-includer-separation/). We have a grantee from Nethermind research working on this specifically, we have already published a post about ideas in that direction (https://ethresear.ch/) and are planning on spend more time/resourcs figuring this out! 

But we think it's good enough for a first version of FOCIL to rely on altruistic behavior from IL committee members, and most importantly it still prevents MEV transactions (that want to be executed on a particular state) to use FOCIL as a vehicle and crowd ILs.
